elements.2211.03199_cb0e502796206c7c2660eeb0fb9e7: We propose KGTN-ens, a framework extending the recent Knowledge Graph Transfer Network (KGTN) to be able to incorporate multiple knowledge graph embeddings at a small cost
elements.2211.03199_caab9e5b96d12ea4846948bf11fd9: We evaluate it with different combinations of embeddings in a few-shot image classification task
elements.2211.03199_d987f0b1388b4cd2880427a99725b: We also construct a new knowledge source
elements.2211.03199_65a823c808f5a26fd09107a8196c4: and evaluate it with KGTN and KGTN-ens
elements.2211.03199_2cc00dd65ea8e435f8727dfa5b2cc: Our approach outperforms KGTN in terms of the top-5 accuracy on the ImageNet-FS dataset for the majority of tested settings
elements.2211.03199_a1bdc6036a4e77554b88ebb1d8f8a: The code is available on GitHub:
elements.2211.03199_b421f8a9304f7e6b2e8d8ff69d1c4: Deep learning has made a substantial impact on a number of industrial and research areas
elements.2211.03199_42eb152d0dff41235662d19d4e8ff: This includes computer vision, as the rapid development of representation learning started with the seminal work of
elements.2211.03199_548d4349e4896a506c7b75ab868f1: However, numerous state-of-the-art models often require large amounts of data to train, which can be costly to gather and label
elements.2211.03199_beb93f1023bba587698f9429558b8: Therefore, an intense research effort can be observed in the area of data-efficient machine learning methods
elements.2211.03199_3df41599f624d7bbca8c3425a4f24: Few-shot learning (often abbreviated as FSL) is a machine learning task, where the machine learning model is (partially) trained on a small amount of data
elements.2211.03199_9cd1c713aade34158a3d0754634cf: part of the labelled data is available in standard amounts, whereas the other part consists of only a few (typically less than 10) samples per class
elements.2211.03199_f33a0745876f8062ab7b6a4915319: Few-shot learning can also suffer from selection bias since the decision boundaries need to be adjusted to a new few samples, which can contain irrelevant and misleading artefacts (such as a background colour)
elements.2211.03199_243f01c6797492539133345a36b65: Hence the learning process is substantially more challenging
elements.2211.03199_4e7f0a0a07ebe21dc77663e138da1: One way to tackle the few-shot learning task is to use some prior knowledge of the labelled data
elements.2211.03199_6d4f3efde7fe739deaa3a06f5cf24: Knowledge Graph Transfer Network (KGTN), the recent work of
elements.2211.03199_bc6768cf218ccce42aca03ba0f604: , solves this problem by learning the prototypes from the external sources of knowledge and comparing them against extracted features from an input image
elements.2211.03199_b706a18436cf336d8b4ba79ab5173: A similarity function scores the output of these two and yields the class probability distribution
elements.2211.03199_1754d941ef49bfa1cafe2f1b35212: These external sources of knowledge are represented as class correlation matrices
elements.2211.03199_21161b7b1250de1c15b60d274af8a: A vital element of this architecture is the knowledge graph transfer module (KGTM), which tries to learn class prototypes from knowledge graph embeddings using gated graph neural networks (GGTN)
elements.2211.03199_7c7724a5fa95956a72fcf36cf85b3: In the KGTN approach, one has to select a single knowledge source
elements.2211.03199_152d01f278c0c6ab2e0b70c6daca1: Inspired by ensemble learning approaches, this observation leads us to the following questions: is it possible to learn prototypes from multiple knowledge graph embeddings? If so, will it result in higher performance metrics values, such as accuracy for classification problems? Therefore, we propose KGTN-ens, an extension of KGTN, that use multiple embeddings instead of a single one
elements.2211.03199_1c84bf865e042c10d689753a2fe4b: Each of them generates different prototypes, which are later combined and compared against the output of the feature extractor
elements.2211.03199_057a16f638dd666e14b03607df711: We test two ensemble learning techniques in this paper
elements.2211.03199_9a0b9afad89d20ac482f7bb8bbf87: We also evaluated different combinations of three knowledge graphs, one of which (based on Wikidata) is introduced by us and has not been used in the original paper
elements.2211.03199_cea37e03ea11336218c5613b3249d: Our solution is knowledge graph agnostic, provided that the knowledge graph is embedded and linked to the classes used in the image classification
elements.2211.03199_e1b7ab3f43a82381c7dbe5e0aefdd: The contribution of this paper is two-fold: (1)
elements.2211.03199_719fc91e38455c4f6a1250e9e01f7: we propose KGTN-ens, a new method based on KGTN, and evaluate it with different combinations of embeddings, (2)
elements.2211.03199_1366d6cc3b986d3ec021144c2d0cb: we construct a new knowledge source
elements.2211.03199_cb66d73f7d65f21ca5fe5f6a29acb: The remainder of this paper is organised as follows
elements.2211.03199_171bcce7076dd17abedd0131e5d66: comprehensive literature survey on related work is presented in Section
elements.2211.03199_602c121796c7b0fb08f5d841e723e: provides a description of the KGTN-ens architecture
elements.2211.03199_71a9f46688683688dc2ff4356b821: describes the results of the evaluation of Wikidata embeddings with KGTN and KGTN-ens with different combinations of embeddings, along with the detailed analysis and ablation studies
elements.2211.03199_3953f69f364fb22444b96552c92e7: This section provides a comprehensive overview of the related work
elements.2211.03199_e972fa6fdc17cd67121f24ac1b507: We start with a brief review of the techniques used for graph neural networks, which are at the core of the KGTN-ens architecture
elements.2211.03199_327410c2e0e9964cc9f2ee74d1fc3: Then, we provide a short survey on recent advancements in few-shot learning, which is the main machine learning task solved by the architecture presented in this paper.
elements.2211.03199_f7f5ad45fcbb47d3a1c6b86d78dd4: In general, Graph neural networks (GNNs) represent a type of neural network, which processes the specified attributes of the graphs
elements.2211.03199_bbd6bdc62a6c1f7ed55f87cfb88e3: Task tackled by GNN can be either node-level (such as prediction of a property for each node), edge-level (prediction of a property for each edge), or graph-level (prediction of a property for a whole graph)
elements.2211.03199_1fc8d35c7c9d4ff5c3b9bcdd30ae1: , a crucial feature of GNNs is being either invariant or equivariant to permutations
elements.2211.03199_83dddce17c787ec9d155e292cb469: The general-purpose models from the state-of-the-art family of transformer architectures
elements.2211.03199_7371bc563a2bd46dafd3bc24b55ed: can be viewed as a special instance of a graph neural network
elements.2211.03199_06263e9ccc17c72a3f96372471f30: Graph neural networks have a wide area of applications, with notable examples in biology (e.g. protein interface prediction) or social networks (e.g. community detection or link prediction)
elements.2211.03199_782e073712c22aa2135e17952e8a6: The less obvious application of GNNs is in the field of image classification, where they are used to learn the prototypes from the knowledge graph embeddings in a few-shot learning setting
elements.2211.03199_8556047612860fd449de5f3490480: GNNs fall into a broader category of geometric deep learning, which is devoted to the application of deep neural networks on structured non-Euclidean domains, such as graphs, manifolds, meshes, or grids
elements.2211.03199_cd2b606d0eed32f4fca2425dddabd: , which is one of the most important concepts in GNNs
elements.2211.03199_d7bff8500099ba93df15a7d0c37b6: In this approach, nodes and/or edges can rely on their neighbours in order to create meaningful embeddings iteratively.
elements.2211.03199_e2e0bf319b78a6a9a7b91cdaf26a8: classify GNNs into four broad categories: recurrent GNNs (RecGNN), convolutional GNNs (ConvGNNs), graph autoencoders (GAEs), and spatial-temporal GNNs (STGNNs)
elements.2211.03199_f5528242d619cf8e33fab30d60c61: In this article, Gated Graph Neural Network (GGNN)
elements.2211.03199_ef4e782f40eb9293f73c1a138ff92: They belong to the category of RecGNNs
elements.2211.03199_db15fabd22d5929a17551a05348e6: For a fair comparison with KGTN (our baseline), we used GGNN in our experiments
elements.2211.03199_fa6cd6891d0d73e132ff776fe299a: , the intuitive difference between GNN and GGNN relies on the explicit graph structure of GNNs, which results in more generalisation capabilities at the expense of a less general model of the latter.
elements.2211.03199_ca6db7ad7a3a628550f4996f170c5: While being very effective for numerous vision tasks, one of the main problems with convolutional neural networks (or machine learning in general) is the amount of data they need to provide meaningful predictions
elements.2211.03199_cf6db57bc7f99efc856acfc21be6d: More recent architectures, such as self-attention models require even more data to train
elements.2211.03199_772219feb1d7f89d4f145b3e1f7f9: On contrary, humans typically require only a few samples to acquire knowledge of seen objects
elements.2211.03199_57c5b27212dc15ed1e251a69c5f21: One way to tackle this issue is few-shot learning, which is aimed at learning from scarce data
elements.2211.03199_b21f783e7d01c16c1e7a541cebb7c: The complexity of the problem often stems from the required sudden shift of decision boundaries, which is hard to achieve using only a few samples
elements.2211.03199_13f66c6af06af22a8e024b0d2e24b: A special case of few-shot learning is one-shot learning, which is learning from one labelled sample per class
elements.2211.03199_60f59d7ee34f162b167736032489b: , few-shot learning methods can be divided into data augmentation, transfer learning, meta-learning, and multimodal learning
elements.2211.03199_1ccf128c1d7ccecd07197fc2cc986: Data augmentation techniques aim to artificially extend the amount of available data by either transforming input data
elements.2211.03199_dcd21f799e36711d2c338e9117cb3: Transfer learning focuses on resuing features from networks trained on different datasets with the required amount of data by techniques such as pre-training and fine-tuning or domain adaptation
elements.2211.03199_9c934c3565913f6bbad7a64a2c45d: Meta-learning includes techniques devoted to learning from data and tasks in order to reuse this knowledge for future downstream tasks.
elements.2211.03199_66b782d1f65d5dca1a679672438d0: proposed a model agnostic meta-learning algorithm MAML
elements.2211.03199_468a02038fbee77992ccdceba0471: Specialised approaches to meta-learning include neural architecture search
elements.2211.03199_ad8957540758c5fee15f5fa90dea0: Finally, multimodal learning focuses on the incorporation of external knowledge from heterogenous domains, such as text, speech or knowledge graphs
elements.2211.03199_e41bf838599ab3a5d219b41db9382: The concept of prototypes was introduced in the work of
elements.2211.03199_49df685189b935414706d6aa75096: , where they proposed prototypical networks focused on learning metric space between class instances and their prototypes.
elements.2211.03199_79897a7b58a1100cd911a21955e60: used representation regularisation and introduced the concept of
elements.2211.03199_aa954e9975269874a3a2b8617a198: in order to enlarge the number of available representations during the training.
elements.2211.03199_0110df829275aad77cdbfad0eabf7: employed meta-learning techniques and combined them with the aforementioned
elements.2211.03199_06d140cc83f94651dd78452c2066b: A growing number of scholars incorporate structured knowledge into their computer vision research
elements.2211.03199_deec65bf0e215da6c78595358537a: studied transferable features with the hierarchy which encodes the semantic relations
elements.2211.03199_76718399952c7c0b7cd9980766c80: Their approach turned out to be applicable to the problem of zero-shot learning as well.
elements.2211.03199_a8ba028da31673cddc71ac3fe0058: proposed model agnostic regularisation technique in order to leverage the relationship between graph labels to preserve category neighbourhood.
elements.2211.03199_4ac5a649adb3f7cc0c87d8f214cf7: This section explains the details of KGTN-ens
elements.2211.03199_50fcbf5163c2f055c068f42e96844: The method extends the KGTN architecture proposed by
elements.2211.03199_5b1d1bb38de318a48e05e60e9a8f7: , which relies on graph-based knowledge transfer to yield state-of-the-art results on few-show image classification
elements.2211.03199_67db4a366894975e1f85d8607a8f0: The most important difference relies on the usage of multiple graphs instead of a single one, which enables the usage of different knowledge sources
elements.2211.03199_ebb5ef9dd472f25ca186c77b85bac: Each of these graphs generates different prototypes, which are later combined and compared against the output of the feature extractor
elements.2211.03199_48fe19b2688935130cdd1b20d855f: It might be not immediately obvious why the approach with multiple knowledge graphs is used, as they may be merged into one using
elements.2211.03199_63327d9bbb4d4c1ce381f37cd13d4: Notice that this method does not require knowledge graphs in a strict sense
elements.2211.03199_7da526ebc840b3a6d50c034430c90: KGTM processes only distances between classes, which are later used for scoring prototypes
elements.2211.03199_07447b132074c8c1979f337119fab: Therefore, integrating different sources of knowledge is fairly easy and requires a minimum amount of effort
elements.2211.03199_419300988b73f0bd6e29e64b69f1f: the KGTN-ens architecture seamlessly handles different types of distances derived from embeddings.
elements.2211.03199_bf1146e475b49df92582df58ed57f: , the classification task is formulated as learning the prototypes of considered classes
elements.2211.03199_e5e315b0995cd06eb0381d0b6a892: In the typical approach to classification, the model prediction
elements.2211.03199_6db8be5db5e54f3105a92cbfe9067: is obtained in the following way:
elements.2211.03199_524f0492fb4b2ac5de1413c9101cc: is calculated using the standard softmax function:
elements.2211.03199_5754e1279a30da8ae686af14002c7: is the number of considered classes and
elements.2211.03199_dc98afc3b47ebed070ff1981c456e: can be perceived as a similarity measure between the extracted features and prototypes:
elements.2211.03199_89e7e43b613d6e9b4271c77bfa939: can be interpreted as a prototype for class
elements.2211.03199_33709db5571c49af134c2de6b8d84: , and these prototypes are learned during the training process.
elements.2211.03199_7e56800d10a26c95eb0f741b013c1: The overall architecture of KGTN-ens is presented in Figure
elements.2211.03199_2c5ba1aba80b2eddb335c5e5ba668: and it consists of three main parts:
elements.2211.03199_133e5f911da43d17274dee0d42bc7: Feature Extractor is a convolutional neural network that extracts features from the input image, such as ResNet
elements.2211.03199_cc5c9734c4f920c1803ee85eeda1a: KGTMs refer to the list of knowledge graph transfer modules (each one handles a different knowledge graph) that are used to generate prototypes
elements.2211.03199_fa9fbfc54c16e2138777dc20c7e41: Finally, prediction with ensembling a module that scores extracted features against obtained prototypes in order to make the final classification.
elements.2211.03199_5fe79cc5c1481bc93eb57c144c885: Since we use the plain ResNet50 for the feature extractor part, we start the description with the KGTMs part

elements.2211.03199_fb40dd8ad97d22244c1090ced5424: This enables us to fit several knowledge sources on proprietary GPUs (we used a single NVIDIA RTX 2080 Ti in our experiments)

elements.2211.03199_be60f524e8d9905da44b5aa3d748b: This section contains the results of the conducted experiments
elements.2211.03199_e764e7c7df2be00c4e19cdced6688: First, we introduce the used knowledge sources
elements.2211.03199_7dff3627d9e9904f9486b8bba2395: semantic similarity graph, WordNet and Wikidata
elements.2211.03199_7394eb2a7812194796664239dc544: Then, we describe the evaluation of KGTN-ens with different combinations of embeddings and compare them with the previous work
elements.2211.03199_79758496e9dfa7a95f5812eb566ce: Finally, we provide a detailed analysis and ablation studies.
elements.2211.03199_a843ffb340e24afe649200510e1e0: In our evaluation, we use three different sources of knowledge, which can be the backbone of KGTMs:
elements.2211.03199_9cc4b49065340859d82ec1b67f424: The first two have been proposed by
elements.2211.03199_6f48b5be4108c7a3d4b0b0a967ccd: The wiki graph is constructed on top of Wikidata, a collaborative knowledge graph connected to Wikipedia
elements.2211.03199_5410701677753d8735aeebc8fbc72: In this subsection, we discuss the preparation of these knowledge sources in detail.
elements.2211.03199_85e4ea2103e8ff8333635e1924e99: The first source of knowledge is built from GLoVe word embeddings
elements.2211.03199_2c08f19b959c2e9963138be5001e3: is defined as the Euclidean distance between their GLoVe embeddings
elements.2211.03199_5bca590c2ca752b276b5f7d589896: is obtained using the following function:
elements.2211.03199_db690aa0df7447dc3936e175af021: This source of knowledge is built from the WordNet hierarchy
elements.2211.03199_67a1041e52f079317472e11e5aae8: a popular lexical database of English
elements.2211.03199_805538de6cabaa2df7e4223f4ceb0: Since ImageNet classes are based on WordNet, the WordNet hierarchy can be used to measure the distance between two classes
elements.2211.03199_42bdc12666e380734bba2cc11af20: is defined as the number of common ancestors of the two words (categories)
elements.2211.03199_23f25823a00454dca6ffeccbc76ef: The output is processed similarly to Equation
elements.2211.03199_0812ae57403045280f97561443ca7: The last source of knowledge is built from the Wikidata embeddings
elements.2211.03199_2d1df38cd7a2612404257434e9772: The mapping between the ImageNet classes and Wikidata is provided by
elements.2211.03199_16394031916e0e50206b97870c47f: Having the mapping, the class-corresponding entities from Wikidata can be embedded and used as a class prototypes
elements.2211.03199_5e469ca886ac5a623a74e7b6e60a3: Although there exist some datasets of Wikidata embeddings, they are often incomplete
elements.2211.03199_60f1a42b7e50a9fb682ff3baf1950: Most importantly, they does not contain all the embeddings of ImageNet classes
elements.2211.03199_bbff8b5896a4fd1cc69b2aefa28c8: offers 100-dimensional Wikidata embeddings made using the word2vec algorithm
elements.2211.03199_c63d59cc9f09c1421140e911ba9b6: , but it bases on an incomplete dump of Wikidata and does not contain all the classes nedded in the ImageNet-FS dataset.
elements.2211.03199_5e651eb3eda20de62f1d36ec7a634: proposed Graphvite, a general graph embedding engine.
elements.2211.03199_a12e4c8ed0f15e495ff9b0867d928: is a large dataset of 5 million Wikidata entities, which is used to train the embeddings
elements.2211.03199_655e3e7d8abcff78262545930fd12: The framework comes with embeddings created using numerous popular algorithms, such as TransE, DistMult, ComplEx, SimplE, RotatE, and QuatE
elements.2211.03199_101aede815226603f4e17ee7eef85: However, 891 out of 1000 entities used in the ImageNet are embedded, which was not enough for performing the experiment
elements.2211.03199_c615f409cce44f2a5391db6312412: We used the pre-trained 200-dimensional embeddings of Wikidata entities from PyTorch BigGraph
elements.2211.03199_5b814b946058cc09a852b62249ed1: The embeddings were prepared using the full Wikidata dump from 2019-03-06
elements.2211.03199_bbe7887649fa0ce171e54bf549925: All but three entities were directly mapped to embeddings to their Wikidata ID
elements.2211.03199_bb9d67f0f47de0c120ef656253317: Having the mapping, now we create an embedding array, ordered as the mappings in the original KGTN paper (that is, as a
elements.2211.03199_b0656a1e552246fbbd8fdf3ed96ae: array, where 200 denotes the dimensionality of a single embedding)
elements.2211.03199_fc88800e3268d5f56d1d98e77fcdd: was used to generate final correlations between the embeddings, although this time
elements.2211.03199_320dc1531b6fac3387e411d0483ef: In this subsection, we present the results of the conducted experiments
elements.2211.03199_6f4a394bcb4f52b88a36f7a4c1d40: the experiment has been conducted on ImageNet-FS dataset
elements.2211.03199_6003a77f3b90d3eab3320e97ecb92: The training hyperparameters and the setup is also described
elements.2211.03199_a67ab333186e34adafe7ebfc72dce: We also describe the evaluation protocol, as well as the evaluation metrics
elements.2211.03199_ad9b55fbf4b71f5491b7fd5fdd584: Finally, we present the results of the experiments and compare them with the previous work.
elements.2211.03199_ca8fc143df8771b2cc2c204734147: Similarly to Chen et al., our approach has been evaluated on ImageNet-FS, a popular benchmark for few-shot learning task
elements.2211.03199_d252c9afd5b3adfe7eee1c2e1f38a: ImageNet-FS contains 1,000 classes from ImageNet Large Scale Visual Recognition Challenge 2012
elements.2211.03199_87bb8e64da7829e68ec4db816da26: , of which 389 belongs to the base category and 611 to the novel category. 193 base classes and 300 novel classes are used for training and cross-validation, whereas the test phase is performed on the remaining 196 categories and 311 novel classes
elements.2211.03199_4fa164b85c7a8c5ef4541b8c15670: Base categories consist of around 1280 train and 50 test images per each class
elements.2211.03199_a881adb3a727d7ac0db4d27871800: The authors of KGTN also evaluated their solution against a larger dataset, ImageNet-6K, which contains 6,000 classes (of which 1,00 belongs to the novel category)
elements.2211.03199_73f117c11bcd312a3df81a4d186de: Unfortunately, we were unable to test KGTN-ens using this dataset, since it has not been made public nor available to us at the time of writing this paper.
elements.2211.03199_40d1e1a8ba9040a379b8a3f14dd1d: To enable fair comparison, we used the same 2-step training and evaluation procedures as in KGTN
elements.2211.03199_1129515792df75c0c2d87c3f6689f: Stochastic gradient descent (SGD) was used to train the model with a batch size equal to 256 (divided equally for base and novel classes), a momentum of 0.9, and a weight decay of 0.0005
elements.2211.03199_23f7d6efdb9bf0996dc4f69f76eae: The learning rate is initially set at 0.1 and divided by 30 at every 30 epochs
elements.2211.03199_6f8150063f400ea4e041eea7cf86c: In general, we used the same hyperparameters as in KGTN unless stated otherwise.
elements.2211.03199_2ae7a9075269f7cc7381e841e81cb: All the experiments have been conducted on a single NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 Ti GPU
elements.2211.03199_282295a4eb8da154f4bdc0c165d15: We used the code released by the authors of KGTN and modified it to support the KGTN-ens approach
elements.2211.03199_78a160a7570b2fed4d0782fe3047b: was used to conduct the experiments
elements.2211.03199_d9a9d98664fcdefa4621e02520217: The code will be released after the publication of this article.
elements.2211.03199_5b0ae446d836d5963ce4323f304fd: Following previous work in few-shot learning, we report our evaluation results in terms of the top-5 accuracy of novel and all (base + novel) classes in the
elements.2211.03199_71f6863ed1d567e853779d643126e: is the number of classes in the novel category
elements.2211.03199_2dee6c5253b50c60ca1435036499e: , we repeat each experiment five times and report the averaged values of the top-5 accuracy
elements.2211.03199_054700cdc10de713e839621799162: shows the classification results compared with some of the recent state-of-the-art benchmarks
elements.2211.03199_6e449371c172b4e918c6cd2659a61: presents the top-5 accuracy of the KGTN-ens model on ImageNet-FS
elements.2211.03199_295a405781f91c6756acafafb9024: Of three possible combinations of the three sources of knowledge, the KGTN-ens model performed best with the combination of
elements.2211.03199_87415bd1fb443d056aedc6427420a: Notably, it performed better than KGTN with these two sources of knowledge alone

elements.2211.03199_64a04a175e83abc9a40bc7c5c10a2: by +1.73/+1.18/+0.20 pp. top-5 accuracy on novel classes

elements.2211.03199_79666caba655f3c39aa3437f9b638: This subsection provides more details on the KGTN-ens model and its ablation studies
elements.2211.03199_235d8d0f02ea53812ed3127756969: We analyse the impact of the following factors on the performance of the KGTN-ens model: adjacency matrices, used embeddings, ensembling method, similarity function, and variance of the results.
elements.2211.03199_c57ccd732260c5084779b7b69749b: Since glove knowledge graph was the most effective for KGTN, we assume that wiki should roughly resemble it in terms of its distribution
elements.2211.03199_694adcc44e9f5bf52849bb85ea093: In order to investigate the similarity between distributions, adjacency matrices have been created using pairwise euclidean distances
elements.2211.03199_7586bbcbc82d5133d3b8a8e84727b: While glove and wiki are normal-like, the distribution for hierarchy is bimodal and most of the distances are the highest ones (Figure
elements.2211.03199_2bbfa900b2df50f620eac62ec110e: To assess the correlation between adjacency matrices, Mantel tests have been performed (Table
elements.2211.03199_4ed521510e9ec63525524f022a2da: The values marked as processed were run through Equation
elements.2211.03199_ab3fdd3d10f8a688064ffd4606744: Correlations of the processed matrices are visibly higher compared to raw ones, especially regarding glove and wiki)
elements.2211.03199_0d61e2297d96e1cacd91e103b87e9: The highest correlation has been observed between glove and wiki.
elements.2211.03199_bbc5bf5d49d466bb3a868bc6324d5: Firstly, we analyse the influence of the used KGs separately (without ensembling)
elements.2211.03199_c9d8c820dcc7e6878b2aa65a5e92f: that is, with the original KGTN architecture
elements.2211.03199_226b051ff5eed11fd26cf0957569c: shows the results of the ablation studies on the three knowledge graphs
elements.2211.03199_980c4ec7009a4b0b554486210f60d: The hierarchy and glove knowledge graphs are the ones examined by
elements.2211.03199_2852c2764e60fb36db87af92ae93e: , whereas the wiki knowledge graph is the one introduced in our experiments
elements.2211.03199_4252cfabd85fa69fa6f10a7fb689c: In order to ensure that the advantage comes from the knowledge encoded in KGs, Chen et al. argue that glove and hierarchy embeddings perform better than uniform (all correlations set to
elements.2211.03199_a15c078599cda8568ee297bc1d1bd: ) and random (correlations drawn from the uniform distributions) distance matrices
elements.2211.03199_c14beb5ddfacd02c6962151fadb1c: Similarly, the usage of wiki knowledge graph yielded generally better results (up to +3.44 pp for 1-shot in the novel category) compared to random and uniform cases, which constitutes a noticeable improvement
elements.2211.03199_992687768d3209ddfa6bcc929df0b: However, compared to glove and hierarchy, the wiki knowledge graph yields worse results
elements.2211.03199_b4f2ba3f0056bc5568597fd69f869: We hypothesise that the difference in the performance of wiki knowledge graph is due to the low quality of embeddings, as some issues regarding their accuracy were previously reported
elements.2211.03199_f0b3ad4601f31f6bf394070de3fa2: presents results for the different ensembling strategies compared to the KGTN baseline, which can be treated as a KGTN-ens model with no ensembling
elements.2211.03199_33e55dbbc22b8694c54d0b25e4177: Mean ensembling gave mixed results compared to the baseline (
elements.2211.03199_e7f78843f90a7becff05ea292eabc: pp. for all classes, both groups for
elements.2211.03199_51e4fc8e90f93c04abf10377596a9: However, using the max ensembling strategy has been better in all the cases (
elements.2211.03199_193c34a442f10eca911e83dd60c1d: A possible explanation of this effect might stem from the
elements.2211.03199_ffbabd767f2646c53af95c208966c: nature of the maximum function, which chooses the most similar embedding to the given prototype and rejects other, potentially improper, embeddings
elements.2211.03199_1af882bbe36f5a2283941f957cb04: At the same time, these improper embeddings still contribute to the overall formula for the mean ensembling function
elements.2211.03199_80cddbb0ab4b5c2e2b512070ebdd4: However, research on a larger number of employed knowledge graphs has to be conducted to validate this hypothesis.
elements.2211.03199_04da5b1d65c01ccb75369567d82db: Contrary to expectations, adding additional knowledge sources slightly increase the variance of the results in most cases (Table
elements.2211.03199_aeca34b17e92cf35a5b9a951f5d90: A possible explanation of these results is the fact that KGTN-ens is not an ensembling technique in the typical sense of this word, but rather a way of choosing the embeddings of the different knowledge sources
elements.2211.03199_49ac6cf8a7bc79890e044cafa5fdf: We report results for novel classes only, as the difference in variance is amplified among these (see also Fig.
elements.2211.03199_f97563da98e048f0c48906c21d31c: No significant differences in the variance of mean and max ensembling have been found
elements.2211.03199_c3df3de6a028ad5498858a3072779: The variance of the results for baseline KGTN has been obtained using five runs of the original KGTN with glove embeddings.
elements.2211.03199_15711fbbec1b72a50b4454202f483: includes data for performing ablative studies for KGTN with the three different similarity functions: cosine similarity, inner product and Pearson correlation.
elements.2211.03199_1c8dc946bceb5f3cf6e07c313ac32: analysed all these for KGTN with glove embeddings
elements.2211.03199_355a1c09e29631f041795b07c9455: In general, the inner product showed the best performance
elements.2211.03199_7a7c21f464e6cd5e397b81bd6e8a4: These conclusions can be extrapolated to the wiki graph, as the inner product usually turned out to be the most effective in terms of the top-5 accuracy
elements.2211.03199_1612222b9deb8828b5b7a1246c290: Interestingly, Pearson correlation displayed the best performance for the 1-shot scenario with novel classes
elements.2211.03199_9d96316775101d1a72dc83d6fd98f: presents results for the different similarity functions used in the KGTN-ens
elements.2211.03199_fe605b044471f2aef8d7c77bf2e5d: While the combination of hierarchy and glove embeddings was usually the best for cosine similarity as well, the results are visibly worse compared to the inner product similarity function (e.g.
elements.2211.03199_f0e355e75cd47bb4e818b246c8880: pp. top-5 accuracy difference for 1-shot scenario among novel classes)
elements.2211.03199_2ed0e91aa57b07038242e9314102b: Noticeably, the combination of these two graphs and cosine similarity function performed worse than KGTN solely based on glove embeddings (for example, there is a
elements.2211.03199_fbbab5cd8918c20ae36d1df91a775: pp. difference for top-5 accuracy difference for 1-shot scenario among novel classes).
elements.2211.03199_c0b862f5293bd02d92679ed6f560d: In this work, we proposed KGTN-ens, which builds on KGTN and allows the incorporation of multiple knowledge sources in order to achieve better performance
elements.2211.03199_c502d8f9fcfe36968d8e1bc79efab: We evaluated KGTN-ens on the ImageNet-FS dataset and showed that it outperforms KGTN in most of the tested settings
elements.2211.03199_bab490f3ad015fc553cb3a1c97aee: We also evaluated Wikidata embeddings in the same task and showed that they are not as effective as the other embeddings
elements.2211.03199_2ea900fc22d4e18b4d7881788af7d: We believe that the proposed approach can be used in other few-shot learning tasks and we plan to test it in the future
elements.2211.03199_d39807e1f6315c3cbc860b1dd2e1b: Although not publicly available at the time of writing this article, further work might include an evaluation of the proposed approach on ImageNet-6K dataset
elements.2211.03199_0dc94d8a39231a265d27c56931d88: A certain limitation of this study is the fact that it might not scale well for extreme classification problems, due to the calculation of pairwise distances of nodes from large knowledge graphs requiring quadratic memory complexity.
